StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [InsertUpdateOssAppointmentEvent]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@EventId uniqueidentifier, @MissionYear int, @Program varchar(4), @TrainingType varchar(7), @FiscalYear int, @ClassIncrement int, @ProjectedComm int AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [RSSOSS].[USMC].[OssAppointmentEvent] WHERE ID = @EventId) BEGIN -- if @intCount > 0, then the Record already exists. UPDATE. UPDATE [RSSOSS].[USMC].[OssAppointmentEvent] SET MissionYear = @MIssionYear, Program = @Program, TrainingType = @TrainingType, FiscalYear = @FiscalYear, ClassIncrement = @ClassIncrement, ProjectedComm = @ProjectedComm WHERE ID = @EventId
END ELSE BEGIN -- if @intCount = 0, then the Record does not exist. INSERT. INSERT INTO [RSSOSS].[USMC].[OssAppointmentEvent] (ID, MissionYear, Program, TrainingType, FiscalYear, ClassIncrement, ProjectedComm) VALUES (@EventId, @MissionYear, @Program, @TrainingType, @FiscalYear, @ClassIncrement, @ProjectedComm)
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
